meanings.definition: Convert (data or images) into digital form.
meanings.sent1: I digitised my old photos to save them on my computer.
meanings.sent2: The library digitised their entire collection for easy access.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally digitised my shopping list and now it's on my phone!
meanings.sent4: Her memories were digitised like pages in a virtual scrapbook.
meanings.sent5: The process of digitising the documents was quick and efficient.

meanings.definition: To represent or store information in the form of digits.
meanings.sent1: The scientist digitised the experimental results for analysis.
meanings.sent2: It is important to digitise important data for safekeeping.
meanings.sent3: I digitised my phone number as a series of digits for fun.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were digitised into a simple binary code.
meanings.sent5: The company decided to digitise their records to save space.

meanings.sent1: The company digitised their manual to make it easier to search.
meanings.sent2: She digitised the document so it could be shared online.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally digitised my password and now I can't remember it!
meanings.sent4: His thoughts were digitised into a complex algorithm.
meanings.sent5: The artist decided to digitise his artwork for online display.
